PaymentResponse.summary: The PaymentResponse interface of the Payment Request API is returned after a user selects a payment method and approves a payment request.

PaymentResponseDetails.summary:
The details read-only property of the
interface returns a JSON-serializable object that
provides a payment method specific message used by the merchant to process the
transaction and determine a successful funds transfer.
PaymentResponseDetails.value: An object. This data is returned by the payment app that satisfies the payment request. Developers need to consult whomever controls the URL for the expected shape of the details object.

PaymentResponseRetry.summary:
The interface's
retry() method makes it possible to ask the user to
retry a payment after an error occurs during processing.

remarks.para:
This lets your app
gracefully deal with situations such as invalid shipping addresses or declined credit
cards.

PaymentResponseRetry.returns:
A which is resolved when the payment is successfully completed.
The promise is rejected with an appropriate exception value if the payment fails again.Typically you will use this by calling ,
then entering a loop or recursive function that checks the
for errors or other reasons to retry the payment request.
If a retry is needed, the loop calls retry(), then loops back to check the
response when it comes in. The loop exits only when the user either cancels the payment
request or the request is successful.See the example below for a thorough example, but the basic
concept, in outline form, is:

PaymentResponsePayerdetailchange.summary: A payerdetailchange event is fired by the Payment Request API to a object when the user makes changes to their personal information while filling out a payment request form. This can happen when the payer is retrying to submit its details after an error has been detected.

remarks.para: The event handler for payerdetailchange should check each value in the form that has changed and ensure that the values are valid. If any are invalid, appropriate error messages should be configured and the method should be called on the to ask the user to update the invalid entries.
This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

-Payment Request API
-Using the Payment Request API
-
-paymentmethodchange
-shippingaddresschange
-shippingoptionchange

PaymentResponseMethodName.summary:
The methodName read-only
property of the interface returns a string uniquely
identifying the payment handler selected by the user.

remarks.para:
This string may be either
one of the standardized payment method identifiers or a URL used by the payment handler
to process payments.

PaymentResponseMethodName.value:
A string uniquely identifying the payment handler being used to
process the payment. This may be either a standardized identifier, or a URL used by the
payment processor to handle payments. See
how merchant validation works.

PaymentResponsePayerPhone.summary:
The payerPhone read-only property of the
interface returns the phone number supplied by the user. This option is only present
when the requestPayerPhone option is set to true in the
options object passed to the
constructor.

PaymentResponsePayerName.summary:
The payerName read-only property of the
interface returns the name supplied by the user. This
option is only present when the requestPayerName option is set to
true in the options parameter of the
constructor.
PaymentResponsePayerName.value: A string containing the payer name.

PaymentResponsePayerEmail.summary:
The payerEmail read-only property of the
interface returns the email address supplied by the user. This option is only present
when the requestPayerEmail option is set to true in the
options object passed to the
constructor.

PaymentResponseComplete.summary:
The method
complete() of the Payment Request API notifies the
user agent that the user interaction is over, and causes any remaining
user interface to be closed.

remarks.para:
This method must be called after the user accepts
the payment request and the returned by the
method is resolved.

PaymentResponseComplete.returns:
A which resolves with no input value once the payment interface
has been fully closed. If an error occurs, the promise instead rejects, returning one of
the exceptions listed below.

PaymentResponseShippingAddress.summary:
The shippingAddress read-only property of
the PaymentRequest interface returns a object
containing the shipping address provided by the user.
PaymentResponseShippingAddress.value:
A object providing details comprising the shipping
address provided by the user.

PaymentResponseRequestId.summary:
The requestId read-only property of the
interface returns the free-form identifier supplied by
the PaymentResponse() constructor by details.id.

PaymentResponseShippingOption.summary:
The shippingOption read-only property of
the PaymentRequest interface returns the ID attribute of the shipping
option selected by the user. This option is only present when the
requestShipping option is set to true in the
options object passed to the
constructor.

PaymentResponseToJSON.summary: The toJSON() method of the interface is a {{Glossary("Serialization","serializer")}}; it returns a JSON representation of the object.
PaymentResponseToJSON.returns: A {{jsxref("JSON")}} object that is the serialization of the object.
